p: CO 2 has an increased affinity for water at conditions above its critical point (31.1 Â°C, 73.8 bar) [ 73], which makes it a good candidate for drying aqueous solutions and wet samples that otherwise cannot be dried by traditional drying techniques due to their thermal sensitivity and oxidation. Supercritical CO 2 has been found to be a good drying medium for food matrices [ 74, 75, 76, 77], aerogels [ 78, 79, 80, 81, 82], and other natural products [ 22] due to its offer of low processing temperatures.
